taskDescription: Evidence for restricted rotation around amide O ═ C – N {\rm O}\text{═}{\rm C}\text{–}{\rm N} bonds comes from NMR studies. At room temperature, the 1H NMR spectrum of N,N-dimethylformamide shows three peaks: 2.9 δ (singlet, 3 H), 3.0 δ (singlet, 3 H), and 8.0 δ (singlet, 1 H). As the temperature is raised, however, the two singlets at 2.9 δ and 3.0 δ slowly merge. At 180 °C, the 1H NMR spectrum shows only two peaks: 2.95 δ (singlet, 6 H) and 8.0 δ (singlet, 1 H). Explain this temperature-dependent behavior.
